summary: This document is an email chain from July 6, 2020, discussing confusion over the maximum potential sentence Ghislaine Maxwell faced following her arrest. It includes a forwarded press conference advisory announcing her charges on July 2, 2020, by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The central subject of the correspondence; the email discusses the charges against her and the potential maximum sentence she faces for her role in the sexual exploitation and abuse of minor girls with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the primary perpetrator in the sexual exploitation and abuse of minor girls, for which Ghislaine Maxwell allegedly played a role.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged for her role in the sexual exploitation and abuse of multiple minor girls by Jeffrey Epstein, indicating an alleged conspiratorial relationship.

events.title: Press Conference Announcing Charges Against Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York held a press conference to announce criminal charges against Ghislaine Maxwell for her role in the sexual exploitation and abuse of multiple minor girls by Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged on July 2, 2020, for her role in the sexual exploitation and abuse of multiple minor girls by Jeffrey Epstein.

There was confusion in legal correspondence about her maximum potential sentence, with one source citing 'up to 35 years' imprisonment' while noting that one charge (18 U.S. Code ยง 2423) carries a maximum sentence of life.
The press conference announcing the charges was subject to strict COVID-19 safety protocols, including face coverings and temperature screening.
